729567f-b.text:
St. George, Staten Island, showing Staten Island's ferry and railroad terminals as seen in a northerly direction from 30 Bay Street.

In view 1, from right to left, are shown the following: the ramp leading down to St George-Brooklyn ferry landing, the terminal of the Staten Island Rapid Transit system, the St. George-Manhattan terminal and the ramp leading up to it from Bay Street, the Baltimore & Ohio freight yards, and a portion of the Richmond Borough Hall.  In the background is the Manhattan skyline.

Views 2 and 3 are in a more easterly direction, towards Brooklyn.  In the lower right-hand corners of these views is the U.S. Lighthouse Station, at the S.E. corner of Bay Street and Borough Place.

View 1, 2: April 29, 1929
View 3: March 5, 1939

P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729567f-b.folder: Bay Street & Borough Place, Staten Island, NY

728613f-a.text:
Borough Place, east from Bay Street, showing the gate and wall of the United States Lighthouse Department
grounds.
May 5, 1929
P. L. Sperr
728613f-a.folder: Borough Place & Bay Street, Staten Island, NY

729711f-a.text:
Stuyvesant Place, north from Hyatt Street (left), showing (right), part of the Richmond Borough Hall, the Richmond County Court House and the Macgregor Arms Apartments. The 2 1/2 story frame house, in the center of the view, is the old house of the Staten Island Institute of Arts and Sciences.
April 29, 1929
L. Sperr
729711f-a.folder: Stuyvesant Place & Hyatt Street, Staten Island, NY

728978f-a.text:
Hyatt Street, north side, between Stuyvesant Place and St. Marks Place. The St. George Theatre occupies the left corner of the building. In the left background apnears the Brigbton
~eiohts Reformed Church.
March 5, 1930.
P. L. Sperr
728978f-a.folder: Hyatt Street & Stuyvesant Place, Staten Island, NY

728975f-a.text:
15 Hyatt Street, north side, adjoining the N.W. corner of Stuyvesant Street, showing the St. George branch of the Staten
Island Savings Bank.
June,1937
P. L. Sperr

729568f-b.folder: Bay Street & Borough Place, Staten Island, NY

728515f-b.text:
(1)

Bay Street, east side, south from but not including Borough
Place to Slosson Terrace. On the cleared area was later erected
the St. George Station of the United States Post Office. The
building in the background is the Staten Island Chamber of Com-
merce Bldg.

Oct. 22, 1931
P. L. Sperr

(2)

The same location, at a later date,showing the new post office
Oct. 1936
P. L. Sperr
Neg. # 3844

(3)

Viewing the post office in the opposite direction (northward).
Oct. 1936
P. L. Sperr
